body: Maybe that's due to the process erroring?
Why is it a bug? If process was never created, zero date is as good time to display as any.
It's a bug because it confuses the user, even if for a short while. `-` or `N/A` would be better choices to display if there was no creation date. Just basic UX.

+1 @rlidwka 
I think it's a "normal | intended" bug but could be easily fixed.

If we're talking about UX, maybe change `.toISOString()` (`2014-07-10T09:49:33.153Z`) to `.toString()` (`Thu Jul 10 2014 09:49:33 GMT+0000 (UTC)`) ?

Second one is supposed to be more human-readable, not sure though.

I prefer the ISO string for dates because it's sortable, parsable etc.

But the point it, pm2 should display "N/A" instead of the 1970 date when there isn't a date.

issue.title: display N/A if date is not available

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.title: [Snyk] Security upgrade semver from 5.7.1 to 7.5.2

Package name: semver The new version differs by 168 commits.

  • 503a4e5 feat: allow identifierBase to be false (#548)
  • fc2f3df fix: incorrect results from diff sometimes with prerelease versions (#546)

  • 82aa7f6 chore: release 7.4.0
  • 731d896 chore: enable CD (#545)
  • 940723d fix: intersects with v0.0.0 and v0.0.0-0 (#538)

  • 61e6ea1 fix: faster cache key factory for range (#536)
  • f8b8b61 fix: optimistic parse (#541)
  • 796cbe2 fix: semver.diff prerelease to release recognition (#533)
  • 3f222b1 fix: reuse comparators on subset (#537)
  • 113f513 feat: identifierBase parameter for .inc (#532)
  • ea689bc chore: basic type test for RELEASE_TYPES
  • c5d29df docs: Add "Constants" section to README
